title.native: 悪役令嬢レベル99 ～私は裏ボスですが魔王ではありません～
title.romaji: Akuyaku Reijou Level 99: Watashi wa Ura Boss desu ga Maou de wa Arimasen
title.english: Villainess Level 99: I May Be the Hidden Boss but I'm Not the Demon Lord

description:
This college kid wants nothing more than a quiet life. So when she’s reborn as Yumiella, the hidden villainess of an Otome RPG, she’s not exactly thrilled. Still yearning for peace, she abandons her evil duties to live a more discreet life. Until her gamer side kicks in and she accidentally reaches level 99! Now, everyone suspects that she’s the infamous Demon Lord. What future awaits her?

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: ชีวิตไม่ง่ายของนางร้าย LV99
Злодейка 99 уровня: Да, я скрытый босс, но не повелительница демонов

tags.name: Villainess
tags.description: Centers around or prominently features a villainous noble lady.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Boarding School
tags.description: Features characters attending a boarding school.

tags.name: Royal Affairs
tags.description: Features nobility, alliances, arranged marriage, succession disputes, religious orders and other elements of royal politics.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Class Struggle
tags.description: Contains conflict born between the different social classes. Generally between an dominant elite and a suffering oppressed group.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.

Utatane Kana is a lyricist, composer, arranger and pianist from Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan. She works for Tawara and is part of KanadeYUK.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Utatanekana)

__Height:__ 159 cm

__[Profile (Raccoon Dog)](https://www.raccoon-dog.co.jp/talent/r12-fai.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/fairouzzzzzz) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fairouz_ai/) |  [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ai_Fairouz) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ファイルーズあい)__

Japanese voice actress affiliated with Mausu Promotion (formerly Raccoon Dog).

Fairouz was born to a Japanese mother and an Egyptian father. She was named after the Lebanese singer, Fairuz. She spent a few years of her elementary education in Cairo before returning to Japan. During her junior high school years, she became familiar with the manga series [JoJo's Bizarre Adventure](https://anilist.co/manga/31517/). Due to her growing interest in the series, she would join Skype reading sessions with other fans. Eventually, she was inspired to pursue a career in voice acting, but her parents initially disapproved of her plans. Instead, she would initially study at a graphic design vocational school before spending a year as a dental assistant. Once she was able to save enough money for tuition, she enrolled in a voice acting training school.

In 2019, she debuted as [Hibiki Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/132856/), the protagonist of the anime series [How Heavy Are the Dumbbells You Lift?](https://anilist.co/anime/107226/)

In a Twitter post on 31st December 2024 she announced her indefinite hiatus from voice acting due to health complications surrounding PTSD. On April 1st, she announced she would be returning from hiatus, and that she would be leaving Raccoon Dog for talent agency Mausu Promotion.

__Awards:__
- Best New Actress at the 14th Seiyuu Awards in 2020 for her role as [Hibiki Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/132856/Hibiki-Sakura).

__Non-anime roles:__
- Belorta - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Soldier FA - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Ayre - Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon (VG)
- Iono - Pokémon Masters EX (VG)
- Eternity - Reverse 1999 (VG)
- Xilonen - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Catherina Grann - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Aikiyo Fuuka - Blue Archive (VG)

__Height:__ 152 cm
__Agency:__ StarCrew

[Profile](https://www.starcrew.co.jp/talent/hidakarina/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hidaka_rina0615) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rina_hidaka615)

She announced on her Twitter account that she married the voice actor [Yuuma Uchida](https://anilist.co/staff/119617) on January 1st, 2024.

**Non-Anime Roles**:
• Miyako Sakuma - Kirisame ga Furu Mori (Drama CD)
• Clara - Honkai: Star Rail
• Neon - Goddess of Victory: Nikke

**[Website](https://mayumaeshima.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_0414mayu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_0414mayu/)**

Japanese singer. She was the lead vocalist of the music unit [MYTH & ROID](https://anilist.co/staff/119976) from 2015 to 2017. She made her major debut as a solo artist in 2019. Her first solo single "Long shot" was released on February 24, 2021 under KADOKAWA, and was used as the second opening theme to the second season of the anime series [Re:Zero − Starting Life in Another World](https://anilist.co/anime/119661).
_Note: Not to be confused with the [painter](https://anilist.co/staff/253860/)._

Utatane Kana is a lyricist, composer, arranger and pianist from Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan. She works for Tawara and is part of KanadeYUK.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Utatanekana)

YouTube | Twitter | Niconico (JP) | Instagram Introduction Hanatan, or alternatively known as YURiCa and KOHANA is a utaite who is known for her beautiful voice with amazing vocal range and vibrato. She often covers duets with Pokota, and cover songs for Kikuo. Biography Hanatan is known for her ability, versatility, and portrayal of emotions. From candy pop to hard rock, ballads to dance remixes, Hanatan does not shy away from any type of song and varies her voice accordingly. For example, in her version of "Jishou Mushoku", she sings in a very high and careful voice, yet in her cover of "Ao", she sings in a rock style with a plethora of strength. Her most viewed cover is "Romeo and Cinderella", with over 11 million combined views (YouTube + NicoNico), as of the 8th of October 2019. Hanatan has released several collaboration albums with various producers through her time, some of them are released under the alias YURiCa (ユリカ), while also releasing other singles for games, Touhou arrangements, and other VOCALOID composers. She has also collaborated with Wotamin, Prico, ChouCho and Korosuke to provide vocals for DANCEROID covers. She also sang several openings of visual novels. Affiliations - Member of Cordelia (Doujin circle) - Member of MyEuphoric (Doujin circle) - Member of Jealousy project (Source: utaite.fandom.com)

Website | Blog | Portfolio | Anison __Kouta Kobayashi__, commonly known as Yashikin, is a Japanese lyricist, composer and orechestrator. He was born in Toshima-ku, Tokyo, Japan, and brought up in Ikebukuro. He is affiliated with F.M.F.

Utatane Kana is a lyricist, composer, arranger and pianist from Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan. She works for Tawara and is part of KanadeYUK.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Utatanekana)
